caseTitle: Mst. Faheeman Begum (decd.) thr. LRs. & others v. Islam-ud-Din (decd.) thr. LRs. & others
tagline: Discussion: (1) If the concurrent findings are based on misreading or non-reading of evidence, it cannot be treated so sacrosanct or sanctified. (2) The revisional jurisdiction is pre-eminently corrective and supervisory in nature. (3) The Court in its revisional jurisdiction under Section 115 of the CPC can even exercise its suo motu jurisdiction to correct any jurisdictive errors to ensure safe administration of justice.
